intro: Dorstenia ramosa subsp. dolichocaula, commonly known as the long-stemmed spiderplant, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces distinctive yellow flowers that are often followed by long, slender fruits. It is native to parts of Central and South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for indoor gardening and hanging baskets.
